author: Rebekah Gonzalez
title: Cher Files For Conservatorship Of Son Elijah Blue Allman
text:
Photo: Getty Images
Cher has filed for a conservatorship over her son Elijah Blue Allman . On Thursday, December 28th, People reported that the singer/actress filed to be the sole conservator of her son's estate due to alleged substance abuse issues. She claims that he is "substantially unable to manage his financial resources."
Documents obtained by People revealed that while "Elijah is entitled to regular distributions from the Trust," Cher "is concerned that any funds distributed to Elijah will be immediately spent on drugs, leaving Elijah with no assets to provide for himself and putting Elijah’s life at risk." The filing added that a conservator is "urgently needed ... to protect Elijah’s property from loss or injury" as he is "currently unable to manage his assets due to severe mental health and substance abuse issues."
Elijah's estranged wife, Marieangela King was also mentioned in the filing to state that she is not fit to be his conservator as "their tumultuous relationship has been marked by a cycle of drug addiction and mental health crises."
According to People , a hearing for a temporary order is set for January 5th, 2024 and a hearing for a permanent order will take place on March 6th.
Earlier this year, Cher addressed a report that she hired four men to forcibly remove Elijah from a New York City hotel room in November 2022, which resurfaced from King's divorce documents she filed last December. Cher later addressed the allegations telling People , "that rumor is not true."

organizations.name: cher files for conservatorship of son elijah blue allman

author: Bianca Lucca
title: Katy Perry viajará ao espaço em missão com tripulação feminina
text:
A Blue Origin – empresa do dono da Amazon, Jeff Bezos – anunciou nesta quinta (27/2) que a cantora pop Katy Perry viajará ao espaço em uma missão de tripulação feminina. A jornalista Lauren Sánchez, namorada de Bezos, também integra a missão.
A missão NS-31, nomeada pelo 31º lançamento do foguete New Shepard, ainda não tem data de lançamento. A tripulação do voo inclui a ex-cientista da Nasa Aisha Bowe, a pesquisadora em bioastronáutica Amanda Nguyen, a jornalista da CBS Gayle King e a produtora cinematográfica Kerianne Flynn.
A nave não irá superar a atmosfera terrestre, sendo um voo suborbital, mas o veículo irá superar a Linha de Kárman, ponto a 100 km de altitude usado por convenção como o início do espaço.
Siga o canal do Correio no WhatsApp e receba as principais notícias do dia no seu celular
Blue Origin envia turistas e celebridades ao espaço desde 2021, quando o ator William Shatner – o Capitão Kirk de Jornada nas Estrelas – participou de uma missão e conquistou o marco de pessoa mais velha a ir ao espaço.
Na última terça (25/2), a empresa enviou um voo com seis passageiros ao espaço por dez minutos. De acordo com a Blue Origin, um total de 52 pessoas já viajaram com o foguete New Shepard.

author: Merry
title: Man City are sweating over John Stones’ fitness after worrying about an ankle injury in the comeback win over Everton… with the defender set for further tests as Pep Guardiola’s side hope he avoids a prolonged absence
text:
John Stones will undergo further tests on the worrying ankle injury he suffered at Everton on Wednesday, but Manchester City will hope the centre-back avoids a long-term absence.
The England international suffered the injury just before half-time, when he stopped Beto, despite the Everton striker being in an offside position.
There is dismay at City at the way assistant referees are interpreting the directive to initially keep their flags down in the event of a tight offside, which was introduced with the introduction of VAR.
Wednesday’s offside incident was described as “clear” by Pep Guardiola, but City are unlikely to lodge a complaint with refereeing body PGMOL, even though they are sweating over Stones’ fitness as a result of that the flag remained low.
City are yet to determine the severity of Stones’ latest setback, but initial suggestions are that the 29-year-old will miss weeks rather than months.
Manchester City are awaiting test results to see the extent of defender John Stones’ ankle injury.
Stones suffered the injury while attacking Everton striker Beto before half-time.
Pep Guardiola was frustrated that Beto was offside, but play was allowed to continue.
Your browser does not support iframes.
Stones has started just five Premier League games this season after a difficult hip injury early in the campaign.
He enlists the help of a private doctor, who works in conjunction with City’s medical team, in a bid to avoid the muscle injuries that have blighted his seven years at the Etihad Stadium.
City have missed the Stones this season, keeping just four clean sheets in 18 league games. But his is just one of several injuries Guardiola has had to deal with.
Top scorer Erling Haaland still only does individual work with the ball and this week complained of discomfort in his foot. He is expected to return to team training soon.
Kevin De Bruyne is also nearing his return after hamstring surgery in August.
Early suggestions are that Stones will miss several weeks rather than months.
IT’S ALL STARTING!

Mail+, Youtube, apple music and Spotify.
Your browser does not support iframes.
Jeremy Doku’s hamstring problem is being carefully treated but the 21-year-old believes he will be ready to return soon. Rubén Dias will recover from his illness for tomorrow’s visit to Sheffield United.
Meanwhile, captain Kyle Walker wants Phil Foden to be more consistent after he inspired City to Wednesday’s 3-1 win at Goodison Park, in which the 23-year-old scored his ninth goal of the season.
Walker said: “The talent that kid has is incredible, but with this coach, this team and the caliber of players we have, Phil needs to do it week in, week out.”
‘Resting a couple of games won’t put you in the caliber of the best footballers in the world. The sky is the limit for him.’

author: GARA GINEBRA
title: Acuerdo «histórico» en la OMS, sin EEUU, para prevenir y combatir futuras pandemias | Mundo | GARA Euskal Herriko egunkaria
text:
La francesa Anne-Claire Amprou y Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, tras lograr el acuerdo. (C. BLACK | OMS) VOLUNTARIOS Varios diplomáticos que participaron en el último tramo de las negociaciones, desarrolladas en sesiones maratonianas de hasta 24 horas ininterrumpidas, lamentan que parte de los compromisos asumidos en el acuerdo sean de carácter voluntario, pero señalan que estaban ante la disyuntiva de «aceptar lo que hay sobre la mesa o irnos con las manos vacías».
